meanings.sent1: I always laud my sister for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: People often laud the bravery of firefighters.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to laud their teacher with a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work was lauded by critics around the world.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to laud the efforts of the volunteers.

meanings.definition: A song or hymn of praise
meanings.sent1: The choir sang a beautiful laud during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The medieval manuscript contained a laud dedicated to the king.
meanings.sent3: The children composed a silly laud for their pet hamster.
meanings.sent4: The laud echoed through the cathedral, filling the space with joy.
meanings.sent5: The villagers gathered to sing a heartfelt laud for their harvest.
